newsitem.title: USA: Digene, Cytyc in cervical cancer, STD pact.
newsitem.headline: Digene, Cytyc in cervical cancer, STD pact.

text.p: Digene Corp and Cytyc Corp said Tuesday they have formed an alliance to develop and market products for cervical cancer and sexually-transmitted diseases (STD).
The alliance would join Digene's DNA probe tests and Cytyc's specimen collection and preparation technology for use in identifying and managing the diseases.
Cytyc Corp is seeking U.S. Food and Drug Administration approval to test for human papillomavirus using Digene's DNA probe assay from samples taken from Cytic's ThinPrep Pap Test.
The companies said they will also explore joint development of other DNA probe tests that could be done with ThinPrep.

"We envision a single patient sample as the basis for Cytyc's ThinPrep Pap Test, Digene's HPV test, and tests for sexually transmitted diseases such as chlamydia, and gonorrhea," said Cytic Chief Executive Patrick Sullivan.
